snippet: Life in Luhansk, Ukraine, is tough, but far from catastrophic. The only relief most people here seek is from the shelling, which goes on night and day.
abstract: Everyday life for residents in Luhansk, Ukraine, is tough, but far from catastrophic amid battles between Ukrainian military and Russian separatist rebels; only relief most locals seek is from shelling, which goes on night and day; city is grim, besieged and partly abandoned, with no electricity or running water, where hospitals are packed and twitchy gunmen patrol streets looking for spies.
lead_paragraph: Life in Luhansk, Ukraine, is tough, but far from catastrophic. The only relief most people here seek is from the shelling, which goes on night and day.

headline.main: A Ukraine City Under Siege, ‘Just Terrified of the Bombing’
headline.print_headline: A Ukraine City Under Siege, ‘Just Terrified of the Bombing’
